text: RT @TxDOT Heavy rains expected across much of TX. Stay home; if you have to drive, pay attention, slow down and never drive over flooded road. #Harvey http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DIJs4NAUQAAtPru.jpg

Please continue to call 9-1-1 if you are in an emergency situation & hold the line until you are connected. https://twitter.com/hcsotexas/status/901833389858312192 QT @HCSOTexas (1/2) For those contacting us via social media about rescues, please keep trying 911 for emergencies and life threatening situations.
The flooding in Texas due to #HurricaneHarvey is heartbreaking. Here's how you can help: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/how-to-help-hurricane-storm-harvey_us_59a166dde4b0821444c37515

Cannot thank 1st responders enough for putting themselves in harm's way to rescue lives. Texas is grateful to all coming to our aid! @USCG https://twitter.com/janetshamlian/status/901840471386988545 QT @JanetShamlian Coast Guard says 8 choppers have rescued 100 people, 500 calls to USCG for help, teams/more choppers headed to Houston from all over US.
RT @ArtAcevedo have reports of people getting into attic to escape floodwater do not do so unless you have an ax or means to break through onto your roof

RT @HCSOTexas Non-life-threatening water inside home is safer than going outside. Difficult & scary, but we'll get to you. Pls shelter in place. Be safe. https://twitter.com/SheriffEd_HCSO/status/901751435909619712

RT @HCSOTexas As of this morning, TX Task Force 1 had difficulty getting to us. So, we are calling on residents to volunteer. Call 713-881-3100. #harvey
This disaster reminds us that we are all Americans, and that when any community is in trouble all of our resources should be used to help.
Our thoughts are with people in Houston and throughout Texas who are struggling with the devastating flooding brought by Hurricane Harvey.

281-464-4851
281-464-4852
281-464-4853
281-464-4854
281-464-4855
RT @GHC911 #Houston 9-1-1 Call centers are inundated. Don't hang up and call back. if you do, then that call will increase the call volume.@HoustonOEM

When the unthinkable happens, we rely on each other for help. The victims of Hurricane #Harvey – good, hardworking people – need us now.
I’m heartsick for Texas. Houston is where I lived after I got married at 19, graduated from college & got my 1st full-time law-teaching job.
